translations: vt.给……施洗礼；（通过施洗）接受……入教；命名……为；净化；使开始（baptize 的现在分词形式）
vi.施行洗礼（baptize 的现在分词形式）

sentences.sentence: Church records show he was baptized on April 26, and three days was a customary amount of time to wait before baptizing a newly born baby.
sentences.translation: 教会记录显示，他于4月26日受洗，在为新生婴儿施洗之前，通常需要等待三天。

sentences.sentence: You're not supposed to let women go around baptizing themselves!
sentences.translation: 女人是不能到处给自己洗礼的！

sentences.sentence: 1the Pharisees heard that Jesus was gaining and baptizing more disciples than John.
sentences.translation: 主知道法利赛人听见他收门徒施洗比约翰还多。
